1.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

2.text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivers from death.

3.text: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casts away the substance of the wicked.

4.text: He becomes poor that deals with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent makes rich.

5.text: He that gathers in summer is a wise son: but he that sleeps in harvest is a son that causes shame.

6.text: Blessings are on the head of the just: but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

7.text: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

8.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

9.text: He that walks uprightly walks surely: but he that perverts his ways shall be known.

10.text: He that winks with the eye causes sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

11.text: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.

12.text: Hatred stirs up strifes: but love covers all sins.

13.text: In the lips of him that has understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

14.text: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

15.text: The rich manâ€™s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

16.text: The labor of the righteous tends to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

17.text: He is in the way of life that keeps instruction: but he that refuses reproof errs.

18.text: He that hides hatred with lying lips, and he that utters a slander, is a fool.

19.text: In the multitude of words there wants not sin: but he that refrains his lips is wise.

20.text: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

21.text: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

22.text: The blessing of the LORD, it makes rich, and he adds no sorrow with it.

23.text: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding has wisdom.

24.text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come on him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

25.text: As the whirlwind passes, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

26.text: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

27.text: The fear of the LORD prolongs days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

28.text: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

29.text: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

30.text: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

31.text: The mouth of the just brings forth wisdom: but the fraudulent tongue shall be cut out.

32.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaks frowardness.
